tutorial.title: Complete Perler Bead Pattern Guide: All Steps and Tutorials

selection.title: 1. Perler Bead Selection
selection.problem: Solves core pain points: material incompatibility, size mismatch, and low color accuracy.

items.name: Perler
items.desc: World-famous, stable standards, common in 5mm beads.

items.name: Hama / Hama Midi
items.desc: European brand, stable quality, Midi is for 5mm, common in schools.

items.name: Artkal
items.desc: Widest range of sizes/colors, both 5mm and M-2.6mm (Mini). Top choice for pros.

items.name: MARD
items.desc: Cost-effective, huge color range (168 colors), ideal for long-term projects.

items.name: Nabbi / Ikea
items.desc: Stable quality, mainly 5mm, perfect for families and children.

items.name: 5mm Beads
items.desc: Large, easy to handle, high tolerance

items.name: 2.6mm Beads
items.desc: High pixel density, rich detail, realistic style

items.name: 72 Color Set
items.desc: Covers basic colors, ideal for practice and cartoon characters.

items.name: 168 Full Palette
items.desc: Natural transitions, ideal for portraits and complex pixel art effects.

faq.q: Can I mix different brands of perler beads?
faq.a: Not recommended. Brands differ in color codes, material texture, and shrinkage rates during ironing. Mixing them can lead to inconsistent colors or warping. For best results, use the same brand for a single project.

faq.q: Can 5mm and 2.6mm beads be used on the same pegboard?
faq.a: No. They are completely different sizes and require pegboards with different hole spacings. Mixing sizes will result in loose beads and failed ironing.

faq.q: Should beginners start with 5mm or 2.6mm beads?
faq.a: 5mm is recommended. The larger size is easier to handle and builds confidence. 2.6mm beads require more precision and patience, better suited for users aged 16+ or with some experience.

faq.q: Is there a big difference between 72 and 168 colors? Do I need 168 right away?
faq.a: The difference lies in detail. 72 colors are sufficient for most basic patterns and practice. 168 colors provide smoother gradients and skin tones. Beginners can start with 72 and upgrade to 168 as they master the craft.

sections.title: I. Automatic Color Matching with Pixel-Beads Pattern Generator
sections.content: After uploading an image and generating a bead pattern, the system automatically matches the closest bead colors based on the selected bead size and color count.
items: Simple structures or images with clear subjects
sections.note: Automatic coloring can quickly complete most color assignments and is the first step in creating bead patterns.

sections.title: II. Handling Unwanted Colors or Poor Color Matching
sections.content: For portrait photos, complex backgrounds, or gradient areas, automatic coloring may result in:
sections.solution: In such cases, it's recommended to use manual tools to repair and optimize the pattern.

sections.title: III. Left Toolbar: Common Color Repair Tools

tools.name: Brush Tool
tools.tip: Supports left-click drag for continuous drawing

tools.name: Eraser Tool
tools.tip: Supports left-click drag for batch erasing

tools.name: Color Picker
tools.desc: Used to sample existing colors from the canvas to maintain overall color harmony

sections.title: IV. Right Color Palette and Color Selection
sections.content: The right palette displays currently available bead colors:
points: Select appropriate colors for repairs
Avoid using non-existent or hard-to-obtain colors
Minimize color count to maintain visual unity
sections.note: When coloring, it's recommended to prioritize using colors already in the pattern rather than frequently adding new colors.

sections.title: V. Practical Coloring Tips
tips: Prioritize consistency in large color areas
Simplify details when necessary for easier actual bead making

faq.q: Why not upload overly large images?
faq.a: Oversized images don't make bead artwork better; instead, they increase difficulty. When image size is too large (e.g., thousands of pixels): it produces too many bead particles, overly complex pattern structure significantly increases difficulty, automatic coloring is more prone to unwanted colors, and the time and cost to complete increases significantly. Bead art emphasizes clear pixel sense, not high-resolution images.

faq.q: What is the recommended image size for upload?
faq.a: It's recommended to keep image width or height between 100–300 pixels (px). Within this range, pattern clarity, bead count, and difficulty are easier to balance, and generated patterns are more suitable for actual making.

faq.q: Are there requirements for image aspect ratio?
faq.a: Image aspect ratio is unlimited, but it's recommended to be close to the final product ratio. Appropriately crop the subject before uploading to avoid too much irrelevant background, which helps generate better bead patterns.

faq.q: What image size is suitable for 5mm beads?
faq.a: 5mm beads are recommended to use images around 100–200px. At this size range, patterns are clear, particle count is moderate, very suitable for children, beginners, or easy projects.

faq.q: What image size is suitable for 2.6mm beads?
faq.a: 2.6mm beads can use 200–300px images. Since particles are smaller, 2.6mm beads can show more detail, suitable for portraits, complex patterns, or advanced projects.

sections.title: Confirm Pattern Scale
points: Confirm print scale based on bead size (5mm / 2.6mm)
Ensure final product size meets expectations

sections.title: Choose Printing Method
points: Recommended: 300 DPI high-definition printing
Use standard A4 or larger paper, split printing if necessary

sections.title: Using Blueprint for Bead Placement
points: Place blueprint under the pegboard (transparent board) or beside for reference
Place large color blocks first, then detail areas
If colors don't match perfectly, use canvas tools to repair

sections.title: Step-by-Step Checking
points: After completing each area, confirm colors match the pattern
Avoid placing all beads at once to prevent errors

sections.title: Save Digital Pattern Backup
points: Convenient for future remakes or modifications
Prevent paper blueprint damage from affecting bead placement

faq.q: Why print a bead blueprint?
faq.a: Blueprints serve as reference to ensure accurate colors, pixels, and patterns, especially for complex works.

faq.q: What to check before printing a blueprint?
faq.a: Check if pattern scale matches final product; use 300 DPI high-definition printing for clear pixels; choose appropriate printing method based on paper size.

faq.q: What if print scale is incorrect?
faq.a: Check print settings, ensure 'Actual Size' or scale proportionally; print a test sample first to confirm scale.

faq.q: What if colors don't match beads exactly?
faq.a: Use blueprint as color reference, combine with canvas tools (brush, eraser, color picker) to repair; prioritize using existing bead colors, avoid adding colors that can't be purchased.

faq.q: Common printing mistakes and suggestions
faq.a: Pattern scale error → Adjust print settings; Paper too small → Split printing; Bead placement order confusion → Large areas first, then details; Blueprint damage → Keep digital backup.

sections.title: Bead Ironing Characteristics
points: Too low temperature → Only softens surface, prone to breakage
Too high temperature → Complete melting, pattern collapse
Just right temperature → Surface melts and bonds, maintains shape
Note: Different colors absorb heat at different rates, black/dark colors fast, white/transparent slow

sections.title: Essence of Ironing
points: Use heat to soften bead surfaces
Bond beads through slight pressure
Many variables: temperature, time, pressure, movement speed, cooling method

sections.title: Tool Selection
points: Household steam iron: Turn off steam, medium temperature, continuous circular movement
Professional tools: Cricut EasyPress Mini or small heat press, flatter, precise temperature control
Medium layer: Parchment paper (matte) or ironing film (glossy, transparent to observe progress)
Teflon sheets can be used for texture effects or heat transfer

sections.title: Medium Layer Usage Recommendations
points: Parchment paper: Suitable for daily practice, matte effect
Ironing film: For important works, glossy and transparent, need to watch temperature
Wax paper cannot be used, will melt and contaminate work and iron

sections.title: Basic and Advanced Methods
points: Basic: Direct ironing on pegboard, suitable for small works, be careful not to damage pegboard
Advanced: Tape Method (The Tape Method)
Transfer beads from pegboard with tape to avoid pegboard heating
Flip and iron, punch holes for air release, control temperature and time
Can achieve flat both sides or back-melt style

sections.title: Cooling and Completion
points: After ironing, place on flat surface, press with weight for 10–20 minutes
Remove medium layer after cooling
Optionally iron front side again, or maintain back-melt style

faq.q: Why is ironing so difficult?
faq.a: Bead material is Low-Density Polyethylene (LDPE), melting point 105–115°C. Too low temperature won't bond well, too high will completely melt. Dark and light colors absorb heat at different rates, causing uneven local melting. Ironing requires controlling temperature, time, pressure, and movement speed.

faq.q: Can household irons be used for ironing?
faq.a: Yes, but with limitations: Steam holes cause uneven heating, leaving marks; recommend turning off steam, medium temperature, continuous circular movement; don't stay in one position for more than 3 seconds. Advanced option: Cricut EasyPress or small heat press, flat heating, precise temperature control, especially suitable for details or large works.

faq.q: Which ironing medium layer should I choose?
faq.a: Parchment Paper: Matte effect, cheap and easy to use, suitable for daily practice. Ironing Film: Transparent, high gloss, suitable for important works, can observe ironing progress. Special note: Don't use wax paper, it will melt and contaminate work and iron.

faq.q: What to do if work warps or breaks easily?
faq.a: Press with weight on flat surface for 10–20 minutes during cooling; avoid excessive single-side ironing; insufficient ironing → beads only surface-bonded, can locally re-iron.

faq.q: What is the Tape Method (Tape Method) for?
faq.a: Avoid pegboard heat deformation; allows higher temperature and longer ironing time; Steps: Apply tape → Flip → Punch holes for air release → Iron → Cool and press flat → Remove tape; Note: Punch holes to prevent air expansion causing blowouts.

faq.q: Common ironing problems and solutions
faq.a: Blowouts: Tape not punched or temperature too high → Punch holes, lower temperature, extend ironing time. Tape residue: Temperature too high or ironed too long → Wipe with alcohol or cleaner. Warping: Not pressed flat during cooling, excessive single-side heating → Reheat locally, press flat with weight. Uneven melting: Uneven iron movement, wrinkled paper, uneven surface → Strengthen circular iron movement, locally re-iron. Breakage: Insufficient ironing, beads only surface-bonded → Cover with parchment paper and re-iron. Matte/glossy mix: Parchment or film not flat, removed too early → Re-iron locally with new parchment, remove after complete cooling.

faq.q: What ironing styles are available?
faq.a: Partial Melt: Retain circular holes, strong 3D effect, easy for beginners. Flat Melt / Pixel Melt: Beads closed, smooth surface, visually stunning, high difficulty. Mixed Style (Back Melt): Back flat-melted, front retains 3D, balances strength and texture.

faq.q: Golden rules for beginner ironing
faq.a: Low and Slow is safer than high and fast; Large works: iron in sections, edges first; Use transparent ironing film to observe progress; Keep pressed flat during cooling.

sections.title: I. Protection Principles
points: Moisture & Oxygen Proof: Prevent long-term exposure from making beads brittle or faded.
Physical Support: Prevent large works from bending or warping due to their own weight.

sections.title: II. Choosing a Frame
points: 3D Hollow Frame: Must choose a hollow frame with depth (e.g., IKEA HOVSTA) to avoid crushing.
Background Paper: Darker backgrounds highlight colors, while similar tones add texture.

sections.title: III. Mounting Methods
points: Traceless Adhesive: Multi-point fixing on the back to avoid damaging the bead surface.
Floating Effect: Add foam tape between the work and backboard for a 'floating pixel' look.

faq.q: Do I need a custom-made frame?
faq.a: No. Standard '5cm depth display boxes' are widely available and cost-effective.

faq.q: Can I stick it directly on the wall?
faq.a: Yes, blue tack or foam tape works well, but it might accumulate dust over time.

hamaColorPage.description: Complete reference for all official Hama Midi bead color codes, HEX values, and names. The essential guide for pixel art designers and hobbyists.
hamaColorPage.subtitle: Official Color Index & HEX Reference

seoContent.intro: Hama beads (also known as Hama Midi) are a renowned Danish brand of fuse beads, known for stable quality and commonly used in educational settings. The key to a successful project is choosing the right colors. Our official Hama Bead color chart provides a comprehensive list of every shade with HEX values.
seoContent.whyContent: Using the correct color codes ensures that your pixel art translates perfectly from digital design to physical craft. Each color is mapped with its specific HEX code, allowing you to use them in our Pixel Bead Generator for precise pattern creation.
seoContent.masteringContent: Whether you are building complex sprites or simple patterns, having a full range of colors is essential. We recommend starting with a standard 24 or 48 color set and expanding your collection with individual bags of colors as needed for your projects.

PrivacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.intro: At PixelBeads, we take your privacy seriously. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our website.
PrivacyPolicy.section1Content: We do not require user accounts. However, we may collect minimal data such as browser type, referring pages, and timestamp for analytical purposes. When you upload an image, it is processed locally in your browser or temporarily on our server to generate the pattern and is not stored permanently.
PrivacyPolicy.section2Content: The information we collect is used to improve our service, analyze usage trends, and ensure the security of our website.
PrivacyPolicy.section3Content: We use Google AdSense to serve ads. Google may use cookies to serve ads based on your prior visits to our website or other websites. You can opt out of personalized advertising by visiting Google Ad Settings.
PrivacyPolicy.section4Content: We implement a variety of security measures to maintain the safety of your personal information. However, no method of transmission over the Internet is 100% secure.
PrivacyPolicy.section5Content: Our website may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of these websites.
PrivacyPolicy.section6Content: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
PrivacyPolicy.section7Content: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us.

TermsOfService.title: Terms of Service
TermsOfService.intro: Welcome to PixelBeads. By accessing or using our website, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms of Service.
TermsOfService.section1Content: PixelBeads provides a tool for creating perler bead patterns from images. You may use this service for personal and non-commercial purposes only, unless otherwise authorized by us.
TermsOfService.section2Content: You agree not to use the service for any unlawful purpose or to upload any content that is offensive, harmful, or infringes on the intellectual property rights of others.
TermsOfService.section3Content: The content and tools on PixelBeads are protected by intellectual property laws. You may not reproduce, distribute, or create derivative works without our permission.
TermsOfService.section4Content: The service is provided "as is" without any warranties of any kind. We do not guarantee that the service will be uninterrupted or error-free.
TermsOfService.section5Content: In no event shall PixelBeads be liable for any damages arising out of your use of or inability to use the service.
TermsOfService.section6Content: We reserve the right to modify these Terms of Service at any time. Your continued use of the service constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
TermsOfService.section7Content: These terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the jurisdiction in which we operate.

ImageToPixel.metaTitle: Convert Image to Perler Beads Pattern | Free Pattern Generator
ImageToPixel.metaDescription: Transform your photos into clear, printable perler bead patterns. Customize grid size, match colors accurately, and get bead count statistics. Download HD PDF or images - a professional perler bead pattern generator.
ImageToPixel.h1: Convert Image to Perler Beads Pattern | Free Pattern Generator
ImageToPixel.heroDescription: Transform photos into clear, printable perler bead patterns. Customize grid and colors, get accurate bead counts, and complete your bead art easily.
ImageToPixel.h2WhatIs: What Are Perler Bead Patterns? Who Can Use Them?
ImageToPixel.whatIsContent: Perler bead patterns are pixelated design charts that convert images into grid patterns made of colored beads. Using perler bead patterns, you can create beautiful 3D art pieces by following the colors and positions on the chart using beads from brands like Perler, Hama, Artkal, and more.
ImageToPixel.whoCanUse1: Perler Bead Enthusiasts: Creators who want to convert photos and designs into bead patterns
ImageToPixel.whoCanUse2: Family Crafts: Parents and children creating bead art together
ImageToPixel.whoCanUse3: Educational Use: Teachers creating materials for art and craft classes
ImageToPixel.whoCanUse4: Pixel Art Lovers: Artists who love pixel style and retro gaming aesthetics
ImageToPixel.h2HowToConvert: How to Convert Images to Perler Bead Patterns
ImageToPixel.step1Desc: Select a photo from your device. High-contrast images work best. Clear separation between subject and background produces better conversion results.
ImageToPixel.step2Desc: Choose your preferred bead brand (Perler, Hama, Artkal, Mard, etc.). The system will automatically match the closest colors.
ImageToPixel.step3Desc: Use brush tools to perfect pixels, adjust details, and polish each color area to ensure the pattern is clear and easy to read.
ImageToPixel.step4Desc: Download HD PDF patterns and instructions, including bead count statistics and color shopping lists, ready to start creating.
ImageToPixel.h2CustomSettings: What Custom Settings Are Supported for Pattern Generation
ImageToPixel.customGridDesc: From tiny coasters (20×20) to massive wall art (100×100+), adjust dimensions exactly as needed. Support for any width and height settings to meet different creation needs.
ImageToPixel.customColorTitle: Accurate Color Matching with Brand Codes
ImageToPixel.customColorDesc: Automatically match image colors to real bead brand codes, supporting mainstream brands like Perler, Hama, Artkal, Mard. Display brand color codes in real-time for easy purchasing.
ImageToPixel.customStatsDesc: Automatically calculate the number of beads needed for each color, generating detailed shopping lists. No manual counting required - just purchase according to the list.
ImageToPixel.h2DownloadFormats: What Formats Can Bead Patterns Be Downloaded In
ImageToPixel.formatPdfDesc: Includes colored grid, color code labels, bead statistics, and instructions. A4 size, ready to print and use, perfect for offline creation reference.
ImageToPixel.formatImageDesc: High-resolution image formats, suitable for viewing on phones, tablets, and other devices, or sharing on social media. Supports transparent background option.
ImageToPixel.h2WhyChoose: Why Choose This Perler Bead Assistant Tool
ImageToPixel.advantage1Desc: Not just generating patterns - directly tells you how many beads and which colors you need, enhancing real-world creation value.
ImageToPixel.advantage2Desc: Not screenshot-style output, optimized specifically for bead creation. Clear lines, precise alignment, print-friendly, making the creation process smoother.
ImageToPixel.advantage3Desc: Completely free to use, no account registration needed. All processing happens locally in your browser, protecting your privacy and security.
ImageToPixel.advantage4Desc: Supports mainstream brands like Perler, Hama, Artkal, Mard, automatically matching closest colors to ensure creation results.
ImageToPixel.faq1Question: Can I use bead patterns for Minecraft?
ImageToPixel.faq1Answer: Absolutely! Our grid output is perfect for Minecraft block placement. Just upload your image, adjust the size to fit your build area, and follow the grid.
ImageToPixel.faq2Question: How do I print the pattern?
ImageToPixel.faq2Answer: Once you're happy with the conversion in our generator, click the "Export PDF" button. This will generate a printable document containing the colored grid and a list of all required bead colors.
ImageToPixel.faq3Answer: Yes. All image processing happens in your browser. Your photos are not uploaded to our servers, completely protecting your privacy.
ImageToPixel.faq4Answer: We support mainstream bead brands like Perler, Hama, Artkal, Mard, each with a complete color code matching system.

ImageToPixelConverter.metaTitle: Image to Pixel Converter | Turn Photos into Pixel Art Free
ImageToPixelConverter.metaDescription: Convert any image to pixel art instantly. Our free online tool helps you create fuse bead patterns, Minecraft art, and cross-stitch charts from your photos.
ImageToPixelConverter.heroDescription: Transform any photo into a detailed pixel art masterpiece. Perfect for Fuse beads, Minecraft builds, Cross-stitch, and Sprite art.
ImageToPixelConverter.feature1Desc: Control the pixel density. Go for a retro 8-bit look with chunky pixels or high-definition for intricate portraits.
ImageToPixelConverter.feature2Desc: Automatically match your image colors to real-world bead brands like Perler, Hama, and Artkal.
ImageToPixelConverter.feature3Desc: Get a downloadable PDF with a numbered grid and color shopping list to build your project in real life.
ImageToPixelConverter.tip1Desc: Images with clear separation between subject and background convert best. Busy backgrounds can become "noise" in pixel art.
ImageToPixelConverter.tip2Desc: Logos, cartoons, and close-up portraits work better than landscapes or large group photos.
ImageToPixelConverter.tip3Desc: Avoid photos with harsh shadows or extreme gradients, as these can create strange artifacts when reduced to a limited color palette.
ImageToPixelConverter.faq1Question: Can I use this for Minecraft?
ImageToPixelConverter.faq1Answer: Absolutely! Our grid output is perfect for Minecraft block placement. Just upload your image, adjust the size to fit your build area, and follow the grid.
ImageToPixelConverter.faq2Question: How do I print the pattern?
ImageToPixelConverter.faq2Answer: Once you are happy with the conversion in our generator, click the "Export PDF" button. This will generate a printable document containing the colored grid and a list of all required bead colors.
ImageToPixelConverter.faq3Answer: Yes. All image processing happens in your browser. Your photos are not uploaded to our servers.
ImageToPixelConverter.structuredDataDescription: Convert any image to pixel art instantly. Our free online tool helps you create fuse bead patterns, Minecraft art, and cross-stitch charts from your photos.

PixelArtMaker.metaTitle: Pixel Art Maker | Free Online Pixel Art Drawing Tool
PixelArtMaker.metaDescription: The best free online pixel art maker. Draw pixel art, create game sprites, and design bead patterns. No login required. Export to PNG or PDF.
PixelArtMaker.heroDescription: A powerful, free online tool for creating pixel art, game sprites, and bead patterns. Simple enough for beginners, powerful enough for pros.
PixelArtMaker.feature1Desc: Choose any grid size from 8x8 icons to 100x100 scenes. Resizing is instant.
PixelArtMaker.feature2Desc: Download your work as high-resolution PNGs or printer-friendly PDFs with grid numbers.
PixelArtMaker.feature3Desc: Jump straight into creating. We store your session locally so you don't lose progress.
PixelArtMaker.gameSpritesDesc: Perfect for indie game developers. Create characters, items, and environments. Our transparent background export makes it easy to import directly into engines like Unity or Godot.
PixelArtMaker.beadStitchDesc: Turn on the "Bead Mode" to see color codes for Perler, Hama, or Artkal beads. It's the easiest way to plan your physical crafts before buying supplies.
PixelArtMaker.sectionWhyUseTitle: Why Use an Online Pixel Editor?
PixelArtMaker.whyUsePara1: Traditional image editors like Photoshop can be overkill for pixel art. They blur pixels when resizing and handle anti-aliasing in ways that ruin the crisp pixel aesthetic.
PixelArtMaker.whyUsePara2: Our Pixel Art Maker is built specifically for this medium. It ensures every pixel stays sharp (nearest-neighbor interpolation), provides specialized tools like a "pixel-perfect" pencil, and handles strict color palettes to ensure your art looks authentic to the 8-bit and 16-bit eras.

AboutUs.title: About Us
AboutUs.metaTitle: About Us | PixelBeads - Our Story & Mission
AboutUs.metaDescription: Learn about PixelBeads, our mission to make perler bead pattern creation accessible to everyone, and the story behind our free online tool.
AboutUs.intro: Welcome to PixelBeads! We're passionate about making perler bead art creation accessible, fun, and free for everyone. Our mission is to empower crafters, artists, and families to transform their ideas into beautiful bead patterns with ease.
AboutUs.storyContent: PixelBeads was born from a simple observation: creating perler bead patterns from photos was either expensive, complicated, or required specialized software. As crafters ourselves, we experienced the frustration of manually counting beads, matching colors, and trying to convert images into usable patterns. We set out to create a tool that would solve these problems - completely free, easy to use, and accessible to anyone with an internet connection. What started as a personal project has grown into a platform used by thousands of crafters worldwide.
AboutUs.teamContent: We are a small, dedicated team of developers and craft enthusiasts who believe in the power of creativity and accessibility. Our team combines technical expertise with a genuine passion for perler bead art. We're constantly working to improve the tool, add new features, and ensure that PixelBeads remains free and accessible to everyone. While we may be a small team, our commitment to quality and user experience drives everything we do.
AboutUs.missionContent: Our mission is simple: to make perler bead pattern creation accessible, free, and enjoyable for everyone. We believe that creativity should not be limited by cost, technical barriers, or complexity. Whether you're a seasoned crafter or just starting your first project, we want PixelBeads to be the tool that helps bring your ideas to life. We're committed to maintaining a free, privacy-focused platform that respects your data and your creativity.
AboutUs.visionContent: We envision a world where anyone can easily create beautiful perler bead art from any image, without barriers. We see PixelBeads becoming the go-to platform for perler bead enthusiasts worldwide - a place where creativity flourishes, patterns are shared, and the community grows. Our vision extends beyond just a tool; we want to foster a community of crafters who inspire and support each other in their creative journeys.
AboutUs.whyContent: We created PixelBeads because we experienced firsthand the challenges of creating perler bead patterns. Existing solutions were either too expensive, too complicated, or didn't provide the features we needed. We wanted a tool that would automatically match colors to real bead brands, calculate exact bead counts, generate printable PDFs, and do it all for free. We also recognized the importance of privacy - your images should be processed locally when possible, and your data should never be sold. These principles guided us in building PixelBeads, and they continue to drive our development today.

Contact.title: Contact Us
Contact.metaTitle: Contact Us | PixelBeads - Get in Touch
Contact.metaDescription: Get in touch with the PixelBeads team. We're here to help with questions, feedback, or support. Contact us via email or through our contact form.
Contact.intro: We'd love to hear from you! Whether you have questions, feedback, suggestions, or need support, we're here to help. Reach out to us through any of the methods below.
Contact.emailDescription: Send us an email and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
Contact.responseTimeContent: We typically respond to emails within 24-48 hours during business days. For urgent matters, please mark your email as urgent and we'll prioritize it.
Contact.socialMediaDescription: Stay connected with us on social media for updates, tips, and community highlights.
Contact.formDescription: Prefer to send a message directly? Click the button below to open your email client with a pre-filled message.
Contact.formNote: This will open your default email client. If you prefer, you can also copy our email address above and send us a message directly.
Contact.helpContent: Before contacting us, you might find the answer to your question in our FAQ section. Check out our help page for common questions and troubleshooting guides.

FAQ.title: Frequently Asked Questions
FAQ.metaTitle: FAQ & Help Center | PixelBeads - Common Questions
FAQ.metaDescription: Find answers to common questions about PixelBeads, including how to use the generator, export patterns, troubleshoot issues, and more.
FAQ.intro: Welcome to our FAQ section! Here you'll find answers to the most common questions about using PixelBeads. If you can't find what you're looking for, feel free to contact us.
FAQ.tutorialDescription: New to PixelBeads? Check out these tutorials to learn how to create your first pattern.
FAQ.a1: PixelBeads is a free online tool that converts images into perler bead patterns. You can upload any photo, choose your preferred bead brand (Perler, Hama, Artkal, Mard), and generate printable patterns with exact bead counts and color codes.
FAQ.a2: Yes! PixelBeads is completely free to use. There are no hidden fees, subscriptions, or premium features. We believe that creativity should be accessible to everyone.
FAQ.q3: Do I need to create an account?
FAQ.a3: No account is required! You can use PixelBeads immediately without signing up. All processing happens in your browser, so your images stay private.
FAQ.q4: How do I upload an image?
FAQ.a4: Simply click the upload area or drag and drop your image file into the generator. Supported formats include JPG, PNG, GIF, and WebP. For best results, use high-contrast images with clear subject separation.
FAQ.a5: We support all major bead brands including Perler, Hama, Artkal, and Mard. Each brand has its complete color palette with accurate color matching to your images.
FAQ.q6: How do I adjust the grid size?
FAQ.a6: Use the width slider in the settings panel to adjust your pattern size. You can also choose between different difficulty levels (Easy, Medium, Hard) which automatically set appropriate grid sizes. For custom sizes, select 'Custom' and adjust manually.
FAQ.q7: Can I edit the pattern after generating it?
FAQ.a7: Yes! You can use the brush tool to add colors, the eraser to remove them, and the eyedropper to pick colors from the pattern. All changes are saved automatically as you work.
FAQ.q8: My image isn't uploading. What should I do?
FAQ.a8: First, check that your image file is in a supported format (JPG, PNG, GIF, or WebP). Make sure the file size isn't too large (we recommend under 10MB). Try refreshing the page or clearing your browser cache if issues persist.
FAQ.q9: The colors don't look right. How can I fix this?
FAQ.a9: Try switching to a different bead brand palette - some brands have better color matches for certain images. You can also manually adjust colors using the brush tool after generation. For best results, start with high-quality, well-lit images.
FAQ.q10: The pattern is taking too long to generate.
FAQ.a10: Large images or high grid sizes can take longer to process. Try reducing the grid width or using a smaller image. If the page seems frozen, try refreshing - processing happens in your browser, so it depends on your device's performance.
FAQ.q11: Can I use patterns for commercial purposes?
FAQ.a11: Patterns you create from your own images are yours to use as you wish, including commercial use. However, if you're using copyrighted images, you'll need appropriate permissions. Always respect intellectual property rights.
FAQ.q12: How do I export my pattern?
FAQ.a12: Click the 'Export PDF' or 'Export Image' button. For PDFs, you can choose to save to the library or download directly. PDFs include the colored grid, bead codes, and shopping lists. Images are exported as high-resolution PNG files.
FAQ.q13: What's the difference between PDF and Image export?
FAQ.a13: PDF export creates a printable document perfect for offline use, with bead codes, statistics, and instructions. Image export creates a high-resolution PNG file ideal for digital sharing, social media, or viewing on devices. Both maintain the same quality and colors.
FAQ.troubleshootingDescription: If you're experiencing issues, try these common solutions:
FAQ.troubleshootingTip1: Clear your browser cache and cookies, then refresh the page
FAQ.troubleshootingTip2: Try using a different browser (Chrome, Firefox, or Safari)
FAQ.troubleshootingTip3: Make sure JavaScript is enabled in your browser settings
FAQ.troubleshootingTip4: For image upload issues, try compressing your image or using a different format
FAQ.contactDescription: Can't find the answer you're looking for? We're here to help! Contact us and we'll get back to you as soon as possible.
